com.jr7.cystudy.controller

Class UserClassController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jr7.cystudy.controller.UserClassController

  • @RestController
public class UserClassController
extends java.lang.Object
    UserClassController is exactly what it's name says. This connects to the userclass table in the database to store all of the classes the a user is connected to. This uses both the User and Classes models.
    Author:
    Zach Gorman
    See Also:
    Classes, User

    • Method Detail

      • getUsersClasses

        @GetMapping(path="/get-users-classes")
public java.lang.String getUsersClasses(@RequestParam
                                                                               java.lang.String username)
        The endpoint used to GET all of the classes a specific user is registered in.
        Parameters:
        username - a string of a specific user's name. This comes from the url, not a json.
        Returns:
        classes returns a comma separated string of all classes a user is in

      • addUserToClass

        @PostMapping(path="/add-to-class")
 @ResponseBody
public java.lang.String addUserToClass(@RequestBody
                                                                                         UserClass uC)
        Endpoint to register a user for a specific class. This first checks to ensure that a user and class exist, and then checks to see if the user is already registered in the class. If the user and class exist, and the user is not already registered for the specified class, then the user is registered for the class.
        Parameters:
        uC - JSON cast to a userclass object containing at least a username and classname.
        Returns:
        string either "User is not registered," "Class does not exist," "User already in class," or "user added to class."
